subject: Design
title: Dieter Rams: Ten Principles That Rule Design
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Dieter Rams: Ten Principles That Rule Design.

hook.text: Jony Ive's Apple designs look familiar because they're based on Dieter Rams's Braun products from the 1960s.

buildup.text: Rams designed radios, shavers, and calculators for Braun that were minimal, honest, and timeless.

discovery.text: His ten principles include: 'Good design is as little design as possible' and 'Good design is honest.'

twist.text: Compare a 1960s Braun calculator to the iPhone calculator app. They're nearly identical.

climax.text: Rams wrote the rulebook that Silicon Valley follows. His principles became Apple's design bible.

punchline.text: The design rules for the 21st century were written in 1960s Germany.

quiz.question: Which company directly adopted Dieter Rams's design principles?
